title: Explosion in central Athens after anonymous tip off
snippets: There have been no reported injuries as Greece's transport minister condemned the "criminal" attack.
summary: In Greece, an attack targeting the transportation sector occurred, leading to the condemnation of the incident by the country's transport minister, who labeled it "criminal." There have been no reported injuries resulting from the attack.
titles: Explosion in central Athens after anonymous tip off

title: US special envoy meets Putin as Trump urges Russia to 'get moving' on Ukraine ceasefire

summary: Steve Witkoff, a prominent figure, engaged in discussions with the Russian president, indicating a level of direct communication between him and the Russian leadership. Concurrently, Moscow's ambassador to the UK stated in an interview with the BBC that the United States is not considered an ally of Russia, highlighting the strained relations between the two countries.
titles: US special envoy meets Putin as Trump urges Russia to 'get moving' on Ukraine ceasefire

title: New Zealander Phillips is ruled out of the remainder of the IPL season due to a groin injury
snippets: Gujarat Titans’ batter Glenn Phillips of New Zealand has been ruled out of the remainder of the Indian Premier League due to a groin injury.  Phillips sustained the injury when he came on as a substitute fielder during Gujarat’s game against Sunrisers Hyderabad on April 6.  The IPL said in a statement on Saturday that Phillips has “returned to New Zealand.”
summary: Glenn Phillips, a New Zealand batter playing for Gujarat Titans, has been ruled out of the remaining Indian Premier League (IPL) season due to a groin injury. He sustained the injury on April 6 while fielding as a substitute during a match against Sunrisers Hyderabad. Following the injury, Phillips has returned to New Zealand, as confirmed by an IPL statement on Saturday.
titles: New Zealander Phillips is ruled out of the remainder of the IPL season due to a groin injury

title: Canucks Gameday Preview #80: Vancouver Kicks Off Their Final Homestand Of The Season Against The Wild
snippets: The Vancouver Canucks (37-29-13) kick off their final homestand of the season when they battle the Minnesota Wild (43-30-7) on Saturday night. While Vancouver has already been eliminated from playoff contention, they could deal a significant blow to the Wild's post-season chances if they can defeat Minnesota in regulation. Through two games this season, the Canucks are 1-0-1 against the Wild, which includes a 3-1 win at Rogers Arena back in early March.
summary: The Vancouver Canucks, with a record of 37-29-13, face the Minnesota Wild (43-30-7) in their final homestand of the season. Although the Canucks are out of playoff contention, they could impact the Wild's playoff chances with a regulation win. In their season series, the Canucks hold a 1-0-1 record against the Wild, including a 3-1 victory at Rogers Arena in March.
titles: Canucks Gameday Preview #80: Vancouver Kicks Off Their Final Homestand Of The Season Against The Wild

title: The midlife non-crisis
snippets: Why the middle years are better than youth and old age
summary: Research suggests that middle age, often characterized by increased stability, experience, and financial security, can be more fulfilling than both youth and old age. This period is typically marked by a higher level of well-being due to a combination of professional achievements, established relationships, and a clearer sense of self. Despite the challenges of aging, individuals in their middle years are frequently able to leverage their life experiences for greater satisfaction and happiness, making this phase potentially more rewarding.
titles: The midlife non-crisis

title: Bronze naval ram from Roman battle recreated using ancient techniques
snippets: Roman ships equipped with bronze rams sank dozens of Carthaginian ships during a major naval battle in 241 BCE – now we know how the rams were made
summary: Recent research reveals the manufacturing technique behind the bronze rams on Roman ships that sank numerous Carthaginian vessels in a significant naval battle in 241 BCE. The study uncovers the sophisticated craftsmanship involved in producing these rams, which played a pivotal role in Rome's victory over Carthage. This insight into ancient naval warfare technology highlights the advanced metallurgical skills of the Romans during this period.
titles: Bronze naval ram from Roman battle recreated using ancient techniques

title: Methane-eating bacteria are ready to capture landfill emissions
snippets: Bioreactors housing methane-eating bacteria could offer a portable, off-grid solution for soaking up methane leaks from sites like landfills and coal mines
summary: Researchers have developed portable bioreactors that use methane-eating bacteria to absorb methane emissions from sources such as landfills and coal mines. This innovative approach provides an off-grid solution to mitigate methane leaks, contributing to environmental protection efforts by reducing the impact of these potent greenhouse gases.
titles: Methane-eating bacteria are ready to capture landfill emissions

title: Driving the CAR to fight acute myeloid leukemia
snippets: A multi-institutional team developed a chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) T cell-based strategy for specifically targeting AML cells in patients who relapsed following other treatments. The team identified a monoclonal antibody called KG2032 that reacts with a certain variant of the HLA-DRB1 molecule. KG2032 CAR T cells displayed strong anti-AML effects in a mouse model, and CAR natural killer cells showed similar results. Clinical trials are currently being planned.
summary: A team has developed a new treatment targeting acute myeloid leukemia (AML) cells in patients who relapsed after previous treatments. They designed CAR T cells using a monoclonal antibody, KG2032, that targets a variant of the HLA-DRB1 molecule. These CAR T cells demonstrated effective anti-AML activity in mouse models, with CAR natural killer cells showing similar outcomes. Clinical trials for this treatment are now in the planning stages.
titles: Driving the CAR to fight acute myeloid leukemia
